name: correction
content:
correction noun
(CHANGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C or U ] a change made to something in order to correct or improve it, or the action of making such a change: She was disappointed to see her essay returned with a huge number of corrections in red ink.
[ C or U ]
  finance & economics
  specialized (also market correction) a change in prices in a financial market, especially when they go down after a period of being too high in relation to the real situation in a company, the economy, etc.: It looks like last week's correction is over and prices are going to go higher.
More examplesFewer examplesI must make one important correction to what you said in your introduction - I'm Belgian, not German.After you have done the corrections, could you print out the document please?I've noticed several more corrections I'd like to make to the book, if it's not too late.I have one correction for the newsletter - our phone number has changed.Make sure you do all those spelling corrections carefully before you send off the letter.
